bigshot

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • bigshot.Image

  • public class Image
extends Object
    A 30-bit (10 per channel) RGB image.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int COMPONENT_MAX_VALUE
      The maximum value a component can have.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Image(int width, int height)
      Creates an empty (all-black) image with the given width and height.
      Image(int width, int height, int[] data)
      Creates an image with the given data.
      Image(int width, int height, int[] data, byte[] alpha)
      Creates an image with the given data.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAlpha()
      Adds an alpha channel to this image and fills it with the maximum value.
      int alphaValue(int x, int y)
      Gets the alpha pixel color value for a given pixel.
      void alphaValue(int x, int y, int a)
      Sets the alpha value for a given pixel.
      protected int componentValue(int x, int y, int shift)
      Helper function to get the component with a given bitshift from a pixel.
      void componentValue(int x, int y, int[] result)
      Gets the red, green and blue values for a given pixel.
      void componentValue(int x, int y, int r, int g, int b)
      Sets the red, green and blue values for a given pixel.
      static Image fromBuffered(BufferedImage input)
      Creates an image without alpha channel from a BufferedImage, which is assumed to be of type BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB or BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB.
      static Image fromBuffered(BufferedImage input, boolean withAlpha)
      Creates an image from a BufferedImage, which is assumed to be of type BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB or BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB.
      String getName()
      Gets the name of the image, which can be the file name or other identifying key.
      boolean hasAlpha()
      Returns true if this image has an associated alpha channel.
      int height()
      Image height in pixels.
      protected double lerp(double a, double b, double x)
      Helper function to linerarly interpolate between two values over the interval [0, 1].
      void multiply(int y0, int y1, int num, int denom)
      Scales all channels by num / denom.
      static Image read(File file)
      Reads an image without alpha from a file using java ImageIO.
      static Image read(File file, boolean withAlpha)
      Reads an image from a file using java ImageIO.
      void removeAlpha()
      Removes the alpha channel from this image.
      int sample(double x, double y)
      Computes a packed 30-bit interpolated value for all channels at a given point
      protected int sample(double x, double y, int shift)
      Samples a linearly interpolated channel value.
      protected int sampleAlpha(double x, double y)
      Samples a linearly interpolated alpha value.
      void sampleComponents(double x, double y, int[] result)
      Computes a linearly interpolated value for all channels at a given point
      void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the image, which can be the file name or other identifying key.
      BufferedImage toBuffered()
      Converts this image to a 24-bit per pixel BufferedImage with type BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB.
      int value(int x, int y)
      Gets the packed pixel color value for a given pixel.
      void value(int x, int y, int v)
      Sets the packed 30-bit value at a given point
      int width()
      Image width in pixels.
      void write(File file)
      Writes the image to a PNG file.

      • setName

        Sets the name of the image, which can be the file name or other identifying key.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets the name of the image, which can be the file name or other identifying key.

      • componentValue

        public void componentValue(int x,
                  int y,
                  int[] result)
        Gets the red, green and blue values for a given pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        result - the array to put the result in. result[0] = red, result[1] = green, result[2] = blue

      • componentValue

        public void componentValue(int x,
                  int y,
                  int r,
                  int g,
                  int b)
        Sets the red, green and blue values for a given pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        r - the red value
        g - the green value
        b - the blue value

      • alphaValue

        public void alphaValue(int x,
              int y,
              int a)
        Sets the alpha value for a given pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        a - the alpha value

      • value

        public int value(int x,
        int y)
        Gets the packed pixel color value for a given pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the packed, 30-bit-total, 10-bit-per-color, value

      • componentValue

        protected int componentValue(int x,
                 int y,
                 int shift)
        Helper function to get the component with a given bitshift from a pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        shift - the bitshift of the component to return

      • alphaValue

        public int alphaValue(int x,
             int y)
        Gets the alpha pixel color value for a given pixel.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        10-bit alpha

      • sampleAlpha

        protected int sampleAlpha(double x,
              double y)
        Samples a linearly interpolated alpha value.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to sample
        y - the y-coordinate to sample
        Returns:
        the alpha value at x, y

      • lerp

        protected double lerp(double a,
          double b,
          double x)
        Helper function to linerarly interpolate between two values over the interval [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        a - the value at 0
        b - the value at 1
        x - the point in the interval [0, 1] that we want the value for
        Returns:
        the value at x

      • sample

        protected int sample(double x,
         double y,
         int shift)
        Samples a linearly interpolated channel value.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to sample
        y - the y-coordinate to sample
        shift - the bitshift of the component
        Returns:
        the component value at x, y

      • sampleComponents

        public void sampleComponents(double x,
                    double y,
                    int[] result)
        Computes a linearly interpolated value for all channels at a given point
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to sample
        y - the y-coordinate to sample
        result - the result of the interpolated sampling. result[0] = red, result[1] = green, result[2] = blue

      • sample

        public int sample(double x,
         double y)
        Computes a packed 30-bit interpolated value for all channels at a given point
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to sample
        y - the y-coordinate to sample
        Returns:
        the 30-bit interpolated sample at the given point

      • value

        public void value(int x,
         int y,
         int v)
        Sets the packed 30-bit value at a given point
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel
        v - the 30-bit packed value to set the pixel to

      • multiply

        public void multiply(int y0,
            int y1,
            int num,
            int denom)
        Scales all channels by num / denom.
        Parameters:
        y0 - the first line to apply the scaling to
        y1 - one-past the last line to apply the scaling to

                         throws Exception
        Converts this image to a 24-bit per pixel BufferedImage with type BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB.
